thread.title: bch
thread.title_full: bch

posts.title: bch
posts.text:
I like to believe that I don’t invest ignorantly; I pride myself on the idea that I put a lot of thought into where I
put my money. However, I am embarrassed to say that I was ignorant, and even dismissive, of Bitcoin Cash, it’s utility, and its
position as a true competitor to Bitcoin itself.
I am lucky enough to be apart of a community that fosters open discussion and one night, a member of this community began talking about Bitcoin Cash and how it had the potential to overtake Bitcoin during the upcoming hardfork. I couldn’t help but laugh to myself, but asked for him to elaborate anyways: it’s important to listen to the viewpoints of others, especially of those you disagree with, as it may expand your worldview and open your eyes to something that you couldn’t see or realize before. As he began talking, I began fact-checking him. As I began fact-checking him, I began to see how dangerously close to an edge of a figurative cliff Bitcoin might be.
Before I continue, I think it’s important to say that I personally assigned a low, but non-zero, probability to the events that would harm Bitcoin considerably. In the next paragraph, I will try to explain how far away the Segwit2X hardfork is.
Then, I will describe a sequence of events which could cause Bitcoin to plummet, along with investor confidence. Finally, I will follow with what may happen to Bitcoin Cash as a result, and will end with some final remarks about my opinions on Bitcoin Cash.
The Segwit2X fork is set to occur at block 494,784. At the time of writing, block 492,480 has been mined meaning we are 2,304 blocks
away from the hardfork. In addition, there will be a difficulty adjustment in 1440 blocks. It is estimated to take 1.4 hours to mine 6 blocks with the current difficulty coupled with the hashpower on the network. Giving a generous margin for error, we are approximately 10-17 days away from the difficulty adjustment. At this point, we will be 864 blocks away from the Segwit2X hardfork. Assuming blocktimes return to ~10 minutes after the difficulty adjustment, we would be 6 days away, putting the hardfork anywhere from 16-23 days away from October 31st 2017. I believe many estimates which put the hardfork around the 15th of November may be a a few days, if not a week, off. Touching upon the time it takes to mine a block is central to how Bitcoin may react violently and negatively with
the upcoming fork.
Currently, approximately 85% of the total hash power is signalling readiness for the B2X blockchain. Therefore, we can assume that 85%
of the hashing power will split from the Bitcoin Legacy Chain (B1X) and move onto the the B2X chain. However, to be overly conservative, we will estimate that 87.5% of the hashing power will switch over, causing a smaller disruption to the
hashing power of whichever chain captures more miners. Because neither the B1X nor the B2X developers are willing to adjust their
difficulty, one of the chains will inevitably die, unless another hard fork occurs to adjust the difficulty of the losing chain occurs.
Regardless, the problem is that the hashrate of both blockchains will be significantly less compared to the hashrate of the parent blockchain immediately before the fork. Consequently, the network will slow down. Unconfirmed transactions will pile up, fees will skyrocket, and panic may ensue as the uncertainty of the future of Bitcoin rises. This uncertainty may cause prices of Bitcoin to fall
drastically. So much so, that the price of 1 B1X + 1 B2X may be less than the price of 1 BTC immediately before the fork. This would present an increasingly large issue for miners who are primarily profit driven. Many miners will switch to mine more profitable coins, compounding the problem significantly. The icing on the cake is that the hardfork occurs less than halfway through the next difficulty adjustment period. The difficulty of the Bitcoin Blockchain is adjusted every 2016 blocks. Because the hardfork will occur 864 blocks after the previous difficulty adjustment, that means 1,152 blocks must be mined in order for the next difficulty adjustment to occur. By the time it takes one of the new Bitcoin chains to die, the other chain may be significantly backlogged, the price may be severely lowered, and miners may be mining coins which have seen significant price increases relative to both Bitcoin chains as a
result of the mass hysteria stemming from the previously described events. This lack of mining may force the ‘winning’ bitcoin chain to undergo another hardfork to reset the difficulty, to allow miners the ability to mine blocks more easily. Another hardfork may seriously harm the Bitcoin ecosystem and may deter institutional investors from investing in the newly minted B1X or B2X coins.
It can be expected that Bitcoin Cash will start receiving more and more publicity starting at the beginning of November due to its own hardfork.
However, unlike Bitcoin’s split, this hardfork will be an upgrade to Bitcoin Cash’s E m e r g e n c y D i f fi c u l t y Adjustment (EDA) algorithm which will be activated November 13th. In my mind, it is not an accident that this is being adjusted immediately before
the Bitcoin split; it emphasizes the blaring shortcoming that neither the B1X nor the B2X blockchains will adjust their difficulties and may foreshadow the problems both blockchains may incur as a result. In addition, I believe that arguments may intensify as we near the proposed split due to the lack of replay-protection. To top it off, members of the community are starting to notice that Jeff Garzik is launching an unrelated ICO, Metronome. Although this is completely unrelated to his work on S2X, a lot of community members are displeased that such a contentious hardfork is being pushed forward by someone who has his fingers dipped in so many other daunting projects. All of these factors combine to help brew a perfect storm which may be set off by the Bitcoin hardfork itself. If it plays out how this article suggests, money may slowly start to pour into Bitcoin Cash as debates about the contentious fork heats up. In turn, miners will be even more inclined to mine Bitcoin Cash as opposed to either S1X or S2X, further compounding the problem listed in an earlier paragraph. The following paragraph will begin to consider various unlikely and malicious scenarios which may result from an extremely split hashrate between B1X and B2X. 
If 87.5% of miners leave B1X and migrate to B2X, an oligarchy of miners have enough hashing power to control more than 50% of the network’s mining hashrate, effectively enabling them to conduct a 51% attack. If this occurs, there will be massive panic intensified by the fact that there is no replay-protection. If this does not cause a slight tinge of fear for the average bitcoin holder,
consider this: when China “banned exchanges” a few months ago, we saw a massive drop of 40% to the value of Bitcoin within only a couple weeks.
If you think that was considered bad news, how do you think people will react when double-spending becomes a real possibility
coupled with the fact that the network may quickly grind to a halt as a result of the split hash rate, the inevitable drop in price of B1X / B2X, and the supposed increased in price of Bitcoin Cash.
While the chaos surrounding the Bitcoin fork ensues, Bitcoin Cash will carry on as usual; transactions costs will remain extremely low, 0 c o n fi r m a t i o n transactions will be processed, and 6 i n d e p e n d e n t [ d e c e n t r a l i z e d ] developmental teams
will continue working towards the future of Bitcoin Cash. And if that wasn’t enough, the use and transfer of Bitcoin Cash will
become even more streamlined as it is being added to Coinbase before January 2018. Bitcoin, on the other hand, will be extremely
fragile for the next 2-4 weeks. There is a small, but non-trivial, possibility that BTC will be dethroned by Bitcoin Cash (BCC/BCH). I was quick to turn my back on Bitcoin Cash when I first heard about the hardfork; I laughed it off as a ridiculous altcoin, an “attack on bitcoin.” But as hardforks are becoming seemingly more common, I opened myself up and took a second look. What I found was a form of Bitcoin that was more aligned with Satoshi’s original vision, and also a form of bitcoin being progressed by a decentralized group of developers. As a final remark, I’d like to point out that I believe the “flippening” between B1X / B2X and Bitcoin Cash is not a highly probable event. However, the sequence of events that are unfolding before our eyes these upcoming weeks make a significant increase in value to Bitcoin Cash a distinct possibility; it’s the perfect storm. This view of BCC/BCH is formed from an english speaking perspective. Other bitcoin communities around the world may view Bitcoin Cash in a much more positive light, but we seem to be
constantly bombarded with FUD and dismissal of Bitcoin Cash on our social media outlets. Through our research, we believed it necessary
to share our viewpoint of this Bitcoin Fork (BCC/BCH) which we believe to be better than the S2X fork.
“While the chaos surrounding
the Bitcoin fork ensues, Bitcoin
Cash will carry on as usual.”

thread.title_full: Moyes tekur við West Ham

posts.author: RÚV
posts.title: Moyes tekur við West Ham
posts.text:
Moyes tekur við West Ham 07.11.2017 - 08:54 Íþróttir · Fótbolti Mynd: AP - AP/Scott Heppell Skotinn David Moyes hefur verið ráðinn knattspyrnustjóri enska úrvalsdeildarliðsins West Ham. Félagið var ekki lengi án stjóra því Króatinn Slaven Bilic var rekinn í gær. Moyes gerði skammtímasamning til 6 mánaða eða út yfirstandandi keppnistímabil. West Ham United can confirm the appointment of David Moyes as the Club’s manager. pic.twitter.com/AIOWnHWn27 
— West Ham United (@WestHamUtd) November 7, 2017 
Moyes sem er 54 ára hætti með Sunderland þegar liðið féll úr ensku úrvalsdeildinni sl. vor. Hann var áður stjóri Preston, Everton, Manchester United og spænska liðsins Real Sociedad. 
West Ham er í fallsæti í ensku úrvalsdeildinni, 18. sæti af 20. Liðið hefur aðeins unnið tvo af fyrstu 11 leikjum sínum í deildinni. Hans Steinar Bjarnason

thread.title: Gamble Jones Investment Counsel Has $30.73 Million Stake in Johnson & Johnson (JNJ)
thread.title_full: Gamble Jones Investment Counsel Has $30.73 Million Stake in Johnson & Johnson (JNJ)

posts.author: Stacy Sanders
posts.title: Gamble Jones Investment Counsel Has $30.73 Million Stake in Johnson & Johnson (JNJ)
posts.text:
Tweet 
Gamble Jones Investment Counsel lessened its holdings in Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) by 0.8% in the second quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The firm owned 232,297 shares of the company’s stock after selling 1,770 shares during the quarter. Johnson & Johnson accounts for approximately 3.2% of Gamble Jones Investment Counsel’s investment portfolio, making the stock its 2nd biggest position. Gamble Jones Investment Counsel’s holdings in Johnson & Johnson were worth $30,731,000 at the end of the most recent quarter. 
Other institutional investors have also made changes to their positions in the company. Lenox Wealth Advisors Inc. lifted its position in Johnson & Johnson by 0.6% during the second quarter. Lenox Wealth Advisors Inc. now owns 876 shares of the company’s stock worth $116,000 after purchasing an additional 5 shares during the period. Harel Insurance Investments & Financial Services Ltd. lifted its position in Johnson & Johnson by 241.0% during the first quarter. Harel Insurance Investments & Financial Services Ltd. now owns 1,190 shares of the company’s stock worth $149,000 after purchasing an additional 841 shares during the period. Ullmann Financial Group Inc. bought a new stake in Johnson & Johnson during the first quarter worth about $186,000. Taylor Wealth Management Partners lifted its position in Johnson & Johnson by 19.8% during the first quarter. Taylor Wealth Management Partners now owns 1,510 shares of the company’s stock worth $188,000 after purchasing an additional 250 shares during the period. Finally, Puplava Financial Services Inc. bought a new stake in Johnson & Johnson during the second quarter worth about $202,000. 66.06% of the stock is owned by institutional investors. 
Johnson & Johnson ( NYSE:JNJ ) opened at $139.76 on Tuesday. Johnson & Johnson has a 52 week low of $109.32 and a 52 week high of $144.35. The company has a quick ratio of 1.02, a current ratio of 1.32 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.36. The stock has a market capitalization of $376,327.72, a P/E ratio of 19.62, a PEG ratio of 2.85 and a beta of 0.82. 
Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) last released its earnings results on Tuesday, October 17th. The company reported $1.90 earnings per share for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of $1.80 by $0.10. The business had revenue of $19.65 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $19.29 billion. Johnson & Johnson had a net margin of 21.28% and a return on equity of 27.38%. The company’s revenue for the quarter was up 10.3% compared to the same quarter last year. During the same quarter in the prior year, the firm posted $1.68 EPS. analysts expect that Johnson & Johnson will post 7.28 EPS for the current fiscal year. 
The company also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Tuesday, December 12th. Shareholders of record on Tuesday, November 28th will be given a dividend of $0.84 per share. This represents a $3.36 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 2.40%. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Monday, November 27th. Johnson & Johnson’s dividend payout ratio is presently 58.33%. 
Several equities research analysts recently weighed in on the stock. Citigroup Inc. upped their price objective on shares of Johnson & Johnson from $140.00 to $149.00 and gave the stock a “buy” rating in a research report on Monday, October 23rd. Vetr raised shares of Johnson & Johnson from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating and set a $137.71 price objective for the company in a research report on Monday, October 30th. Leerink Swann reaffirmed an “outperform” rating and set a $165.00 price objective (up previously from $150.00) on shares of Johnson & Johnson in a research report on Wednesday, October 18th. Royal Bank Of Canada upped their price objective on shares of Johnson & Johnson from $144.00 to $147.00 and gave the stock an “outperform” rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 18th. Finally, Stifel Nicolaus upped their price objective on shares of Johnson & Johnson from $140.00 to $142.00 and gave the stock a “hold” rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 18th. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, eight have given a hold rating and eleven have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. Johnson & Johnson presently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus price target of $143.70. 
About Johnson & Johnson 
Johnson & Johnson is a holding company, which is engaged in the research and development, manufacture and sale of a range of products in the healthcare field. It operates through three segments: Consumer, Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices. Its primary focus is products related to human health and well-being.   Johnson & Johnson   Johnson & Johnson
